item.title: 亚洲股市下跌；新西兰央行会议前新西兰元走强
item.description: 亚洲股市周三小幅走低，此前美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）对美国今年晚些时候降息的预期时间没有给出什么暗示，尽管他表示对通胀即将回落有更大的信心。【原文：Asian stocks edged marginally lower on Wednesday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell offered little hints on the timing of U.S. rate cuts expected later this year, even as he signalled greater confidence that inflation was coming to heel.】

item.title: 需求疲软，中国 6 月消费通胀不及预期
item.description: 6 月份，中国居民消费价格连续第五个月增长，但低于预期，而生产者价格通货紧缩依然存在，政府的支持措施使世界第二大经济体的复苏步履维艰。【原文：China's consumer prices grew for a fifth month in June but missed expectations, while producer price deflation persisted, as government support measures set a bumpy recovery in motion for the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 受 KKR 股份出售报告影响，国际电气股价下跌 9
item.description: 在路透社报道私募股权公司 KKR 计划减持这家日本芯片设备制造商的股份后一天，国际电气的股价在周三东京早盘交易中下跌了 9%。【原文：Shares in Kokusai Electric fell 9% in early Tokyo trading on Wednesday, a day after Reuters reported private equity firm KKR plans to cut its stake in the Japanese chip equipment manufacturer.】

item.title: 美元因鲍威尔的谨慎而坚挺，奇异果在利率决定前等待时机
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）对何时降息持谨慎态度后，美元在周三从三周低点反弹。【原文：The dollar was on the front foot on Wednesday having rebounded from a three-week low after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell struck a cautious tone on how soon interest rate cuts would come.】

item.title: 美国库存下降，降息前景光明，石油反弹
item.description: 行业报告显示上周美国原油和燃料库存下降，表明需求稳定，而且降息前景改善，油价在连续三天下跌后于周三反弹。【原文：Oil prices rebounded on Wednesday following three days of declines after an industry report showed U.S. crude and fuel stockpiles fell last week, indicating steady demand, and the outlook for interest rate cuts improved.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国平安正考虑发行最高 50 亿美元的可转换债券
item.description: 据两位直接知情人士透露，中国平安保险正在考虑发行价值高达 50 亿美元的可转换债券。【原文：China's Ping An Insurance is considering issuing a convertible bond worth up to $5 billion, according to two sources with direct knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 日元疲软提高进口成本，日本批发通胀率回升
item.description: 周三的数据显示，由于日元汇率下跌推高了原材料进口成本，日本6月份的批发通胀率加速上升，使市场对央行近期加息的预期持续升温。【原文：Japan's wholesale inflation accelerated in June as the yen's declines pushed up the cost of raw material imports, data showed on Wednesday, keeping alive market expectations for a near-term interest rate hike by the central bank.】

item.title: IDC 称第二季度全球 PC 出货量增长，苹果增幅最大
item.description: 研究公司IDC周二发布的初步数据显示，受人工智能设备需求的推动，第二季度全球个人电脑出货量增长了3%，其中苹果公司的增长幅度在个人电脑制造商中最大。【原文：Global shipments of personal computers rose by 3% in the second quarter, helped by demand for AI-capable devices, with Apple seeing the biggest growth among PC makers, preliminary data from research firm IDC showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 上诉法院获胜后，美国私募基金敦促监管机构废除其他规则
item.description: 在美国上诉法院上月裁定美国证券交易委员会无权监管投资顾问行业后，私人基金组织周二要求美国证券交易委员会撤回三项针对投资顾问的拟议规则。【原文：Private fund groups asked the Securities and Exchange Commission on Tuesday to withdraw three proposed rules aimed at investment advisers after a U.S. appeals court last month said the agency did not have the authority to oversee the sector.】

item.title: Blackstone 聘请花旗资深员工 Tyler Dickson 在信贷业务中担任重要职务
item.description: Blackstone Inc 已聘请花旗集团投资银行部前全球主管 Tyler Dickson 负责其信贷和保险部门的客户关系，该私募股权投资公司周二表示。【原文：Blackstone Inc has hired Tyler Dickson, the former global head of investment banking at Citigroup, to lead client relations for its credit and insurance unit, the private equity firm said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 联合国航空理事会启动对美国航空安全监督的审计
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局的一位官员周二告诉记者，联合国航空理事会本周将启动自2007年以来对美国民航安全监督系统的首次审计。【原文：The U.N. aviation council this week will launch the first audit of the U.S. civil aviation safety oversight system since 2007, a U.S. Federal Aviation Administration official told reporters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞标辩论差饷的命运
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 美国财政部部长耶伦：随着时间推移，通胀将继续缓解
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周二表示，房租和住房成本使美国通胀率高于预期，但随着时间的推移，消费价格压力将继续下降，白宫的一位高级顾问也提到了她所说的在降低通胀方面取得的 "巨大进展"。【原文：Rent and housing costs are keeping U.S. inflation higher than preferred but consumer price pressures will continue to come down over time, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Tuesday, as a top White House adviser cited what she called "tremendous progress" in bringing down inflation.】

item.title: 亿万富翁投资人阿克曼启动新美国基金的筹资工作
item.description: 对冲基金经理比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）周二启动了新的美国上市封闭式基金的筹资工作，熟悉内情的人士称，这项工作可能会带来多达 200 亿美元的资金，使他管理的资产增加一倍多，其中部分资金来自散户投资者。【原文：Hedge fund manager Bill Ackman kicked off fundraising for a new U.S.-listed closed-end fund on Tuesday, an effort people familiar with the matter say could bring in as much as $20 billion, more than double his assets under management, some of that from retail investors.】

item.title: Chipotle Mexican Grill 首席财务官哈顿将于明年退休
item.description: Chipotle Mexican Grill 公司周二表示，该公司长期担任财务主管的资深人士杰克-哈同（Jack Hartung）将于明年 3 月 31 日卸任。【原文：Chipotle Mexican Grill said on Tuesday that Jack Hartung, its long time veteran, would be stepping down and retiring from his role as finance chief effective March 31 next year.】

item.title: UPS 任命内部人士 Brian Dykes 为新任首席财务官
item.description: 联合包裹服务公司周二任命内部人士 Brian Dykes 为新任首席财务官，立即生效。【原文：United Parcel Service on Tuesday appointed insider Brian Dykes as its new CFO, effective immediately.】

item.title: 普渡制药公司在美国国会做出裁决后寻求诉讼停火
item.description: 普渡制药公司周二请求美国破产法官在 60 天内冻结针对其所有者--富裕的萨克勒家族成员--的诉讼，这是该公司在最高法院的一项具有里程碑意义的裁决破坏了其破产解决方案后首次出庭。【原文：Purdue Pharma on Tuesday asked a U.S. bankruptcy judge for a 60-day freeze on lawsuits against its owners, members of the wealthy Sackler family, in its first court appearance since a landmark Supreme Court ruling upended its bankruptcy settlement.】

item.title: 贝里尔风暴后，联合太平洋公司在得克萨斯州的大部分地区恢复运营
item.description: 联合太平洋公司（Union Pacific）周二表示，该公司已基本恢复了受飓风贝里尔影响的得克萨斯州的运营，但预计在商业电力和道路交通完全恢复之前，运营仍会受到一些干扰。【原文：Union Pacific said on Tuesday it has mostly resumed operations impacted due to Hurricane Beryl in Texas but expects some disruptions till commercial power and road accessibility are fully restored.】

item.title: 密歇根州降低对福特电动汽车电池厂的奖励，以配合产量的减少
item.description: 在福特汽车削减了位于马歇尔市的电池工厂的预期产量以满足电动汽车的需求之后，福特汽车从密歇根州获得的激励方案有所减少。【原文：Ford Motor is receiving a reduced incentive package from Michigan for its battery plant in the city of Marshall after the automaker cut expected production at the facility to match demand for electric vehicles.】

item.title: 大众汽车集团下调对可能关闭奥迪布鲁塞尔生产基地及其他开支的预期
item.description: 大众汽车集团周二将其运营回报率预期从 7-7.5% 下调至 6.5-7%，同时宣布，由于对其生产的电动高端汽车需求低迷，奥迪品牌正在考虑关闭布鲁塞尔生产基地。【原文：Volkswagen Group lowered its forecast for operating returns on Tuesday to 6.5-7% from 7-7.5% as it announced that the Audi brand was considering closing its Brussels site because of low demand for the electric higher-end cars it produces.】

item.title: 标普 500 指数的科技主导地位引发投资组合多样化的呼声
item.description: S&P 500 指数与等权重指数之间的收益差距达到了 15 年来的最大值，这凸显了在 Nvidia 等人工智能重量级公司之外进行多元化投资的必要性。【原文：The gap in returns between the S&P 500 and the index's equal-weighted counterpart is at its widest in 15 years, underscoring the need to diversify beyond AI heavyweights such as Nvidia.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，甲骨文与马斯克 xAI 的百亿美元服务器交易谈判失效
item.description: 据 The Information 周二报道，亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司 xAI 和科技巨头甲骨文公司（Oracle）已经结束了潜在的 100 亿美元服务器交易谈判。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI and tech giant Oracle have ended talks on a potential $10 billion server deal, The Information reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 智利将考虑私营部门提出的 81 个锂项目提案
item.description: 智利官员周二表示，他们将考虑南美各国的 81 个锂项目提案，使该国有望超过在 2026 年底前启动四个新项目的目标。【原文：Chilean officials on Tuesday said they will consider 81 proposals for lithium projects across the South American country, putting the country on track to surpass a goal of launching four new projects by the end of 2026.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔：央行独立带来好结果
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周二在国会小组会议上发表评论时表示，中央银行的独立性是实现美国经济最佳成果的一种行之有效且得到广泛支持的方式。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said central bank independence is a proven and well-supported way to achieve the best possible outcomes for the U.S. economy, in comments before a congressional panel on Tuesday.】

item.title: 报纸称咨询公司推荐淡水河谷 15 名首席执行官候选人
item.description: 据当地报纸《O Globo》周二报道，淡水河谷聘请的一家咨询公司已向这家巴西矿业公司的董事会推荐了 15 名潜在候选人，以帮助其开展首席执行官继任工作。【原文：A consulting firm hired by Vale to help it with its CEO succession process has presented the Brazilian miner's board of directors with 15 potential candidates, local newspaper O Globo reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 利雅得航空与达美航空合作发展网络
item.description: 利雅得航空公司（Riyadh Air）周二表示，该公司已与美国达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）建立了合作伙伴关系，这家沙特新成立的航空公司将在明年投入商业运营之前扩大其潜在网络。【原文：Riyadh Air said on Tuesday it has partnered with U.S. carrier Delta Air Lines as the Saudi startup carrier grows its potential network ahead of launching commercial operations next year.】

item.title: 印度希望与俄罗斯石油公司及其他俄罗斯公司达成能源交易
item.description: 印度外交大臣维纳伊-莫汉-夸特拉（Vinay Mohan Kwatra）周二表示，印度希望加强与俄罗斯的能源关系，并可能寻求与俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）和其他主要俄罗斯石油公司达成交易，作为促进双边贸易的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：India wants to strengthen its energy ties with Russia and could seek deals with Rosneft and other leading Russian oil firms as part of a broader push to boost bilateral trade, Foreign Secretary Vinay Mohan Kwatra said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 第五季保险公司因虚假银行账户和汽车收回被美国联邦储蓄委员会罚款
item.description: 美国第五第三银行公司（Fifth Third Bancorp）将支付 2,000 万美元的民事罚款，并向 35,000 名受害消费者提供补偿，以平息美国消费者金融保护局（U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau）对其开设未经授权账户和非法收回消费者汽车的指控。【原文：Fifth Third Bancorp will pay $20 million in civil fines and offer redress to 35,000 harmed consumers to settle U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau charges it opened unauthorized accounts and illegally repossessed their cars.】

item.title: 高盛资产经理认为美国经济和股市正在放缓
item.description: 高盛资产管理公司（Goldman Sachs Asset Management）高管周二表示，预计 2024 年下半年美国经济增速将放缓至 2% 左右，受盈利增长下滑和政治忧虑影响，股票指数将基本持平。【原文：Goldman Sachs Asset Management executives expect the U.S. economy to grow at a slower clip of about 2% in the second half of 2024, they said on Tuesday, with equity indexes seen largely flat due to declining earnings growth and political anxieties.】

item.title: 美国监管机构将就虚假账户和汽车保险对第五第三保险公司罚款 2000 万美元
item.description: 美国消费者金融保护最高监管机构周二表示，将对俄亥俄州贷款机构第五第三银行罚款 2000 万美元，原因是该机构涉嫌开设虚假客户账户，并强迫已投保的消费者购买汽车保险等。【原文：The top U.S. watchdog for consumer financial protection said Tuesday it would fine Ohio lender Fifth Third Bank $20 million for allegedly opening fake customer accounts and forcing auto insurance on consumers who already had coverage, among other allegations.】
